result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:05 PM Defendant Andrew T Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Andrew T Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for status. 
Parties have come to a resolution. 
Defense requests a firm offer. Court orders a firm global offer to be sent to Atty Bonneson no later than November 11, 2022. 
Defense requests a Plea only hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of DVD Statements, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 5th, 2022.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of DVD Statements, filed by the State.

9:36 AM Defendant Andrew T Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Andrew T Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for status.
Defense is still seeking a global pre-trial offer. 
Defense requests one further proceedings date.
State to file any Motions for Joinder before the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:48 AM Defendant Andrew T Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Andrew T Moore.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
City of Oconomowoc Police Officer Adam Parkhurst sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Tempelis.  Cross examination by Atty. Bonneson.  Redirect.  City of Oconomowoc detective Andrew Rich sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Tempelis.  Cross examination by Atty. Bonneson.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Tempelis moves for bind over and makes closing statements.  Atty. Bonneson moves to dismiss and makes closing statement.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Bail remains as fixed. Date remains as previously set.Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with any victims or witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim and witness, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. Not to use any social media, not come within 1,000 feet of a school or day care.  Defendant to have no contact with any child under the age of 18. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content.

08:31 AM Defendant Andrew T Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called for Motion Hearing and Initial Appearance on 22CF1221.
State and Defense make arguments on the record regarding the Motion for Joinder filed by the State in 21CF915, 21CF1181, and 22CF340.
Court grants the Motion for Joinder for reasons as stated on the record.
State requests adjournment of trial due to unavailability of witnesses.
Court grants and removes jury status hearing and jury trial from the calendar. 

Court addresses the Initial Appearance in 22CF1221.
Defense acknowledges receipt of Complaint and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
State and Defense make bond recommendations. 
Court makes a finding that the defendant is a flight risk. 
Court sets bond with conditions. 
Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Other cases will tagalong. 

  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
